text: although kite news look very simple
these mollusks have a very sophisticated
shell the shells outer layer is full of
black bumps that on close inspection
turn out to be very tiny eyes
complete with light-sensitive cells and
a lens surprisingly the eyes lens is
made of the same calcium carbonate
material as the rest of the shell while
most of the opaque shell consists of
tiny irregularly oriented grains the
grains and the lens are much larger and
aligned to let light pass through with
little scattering researchers have shown
that these eyes can actually see each
one forms a complete image on its retina
a fish in these experiments at best
the Titans can probably detect predators
up to two metres away giving them an
opportunity to clamp down tight and
avoid being eaten
Titans can't move very fast so they
depend on their hard armor to keep them
safe the eyes are chinks in that armor
but as they provide advanced warning of
any attacks still more than make up for
it
